1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Moving Average Envelopes
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Bands plotted at a fixed percentage above and below a moving average.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Upper Band = SMA * (1 + Percentage/100)</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>Lower Band = SMA * (1 - Percentage/100)</description></item>
14 /// </list>
15 /// </remarks>
16 public class Envelope
17 {
18 public int Period { get; }
19 public decimal Percentage { get; }
20 public List<decimal?> UpperBand { get; } = new();
21 public List<decimal?> MiddleBand { get; } = new();
22 public List<decimal?> LowerBand { get; } = new();
23​
24 public Envelope(int period = 20, decimal percentage = 2.5m)
25 {
26 Period = period;
27 Percentage = percentage;
28 }
29​
30 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
31 {
32 UpperBand.Clear();
33 MiddleBand.Clear();
34 LowerBand.Clear();
35​
36 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
37 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
38​
39 // Step 1: Calculate SMA
40 decimal sum = 0;
41​
42 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
43 {
44 sum += candleList[i].Close;
45 if (i >= Period)
46 sum -= candleList[i - Period].Close;
47​
48 if (i < Period - 1)
49 {
50 UpperBand.Add(null);
51 MiddleBand.Add(null);
52 LowerBand.Add(null);
53 continue;
54 }
55​
56 decimal sma = sum / Period;
57
58 // Step 2: Calculate Offsets
59 decimal offset = sma * (Percentage / 100);
60​
61 MiddleBand.Add(sma);
62 UpperBand.Add(sma + offset);
63 LowerBand.Add(sma - offset);
64 }
65 }
66​
67 public static (List<decimal?> upper, List<decimal?> middle, List<decimal?> lower) Calculate(
68 IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 20, decimal percentage = 2.5m)
69 {
70 var env = new Envelope(period, percentage);
71 env.Calculate(candles);
72 return (env.UpperBand, env.MiddleBand, env.LowerBand);
73 }
74 }
75}

1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (Envelope)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Moving Average Envelopes technical indicator.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. Bands and Channels
13// [Why] To define a range of "normality" around the price trend.
14// [What] Prices usually stay within a certain distance from their average.
15// When they go outside this distance, it's considered "extreme".
16//
17// 2. Fixed Deviation (Percentage)
18// [Why] Unlike Bollinger Bands (which use Volatility), Envelopes use a fixed %
19// to set the width of the channel.
20// [Pros] Simple and predictable.
21// [Cons] Doesn't adjust to market volatility (too wide in calm markets, too narrow in crises).
22//
23// 3. Components
24// - Middle Band: Simple Moving Average (SMA).
25// - Upper Band: SMA + (SMA * Percentage).
26// - Lower Band: SMA - (SMA * Percentage).
27//
28// [Visual Plan]
29// Input Prices: [100, 102, 101, 103, 105...]
30// SMA (Avg): [ - , - , 101, 102, 103...]
31// +10% Band: [ - , - , 111, 112, 113...]
32// -10% Band: [ - , - , 91, 92, 93...]
33//
34// =============================================================================
35​
36using System;
37using System.Collections.Generic;
38​
39namespace TechnicalIndicators
40{
41 // =============================================================================
42 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
43 // =============================================================================
44 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
45​
46 // =============================================================================
47 // Logic Explanation: Envelope Indicator Class
48 // =============================================================================
49 public class Envelope
50 {
51 // -------------------------------------------------------------
52 // Logic Explanation: Configuration
53 // -------------------------------------------------------------
54 public int Period { get; }
55 public decimal Percentage { get; }
56 public List<decimal?> UpperBand { get; } = new();
57 public List<decimal?> MiddleBand { get; } = new();
58 public List<decimal?> LowerBand { get; } = new();
59​
60 // =============================================================================
61 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
62 // =============================================================================
63 public Envelope(int period = 20, decimal percentage = 2.5m)
64 {
65 if (period <= 0)
66 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be greater than 0");
67 Period = period;
68 Percentage = percentage;
69 }
70​
71 // =============================================================================
72 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
73 // =============================================================================
74 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
75 {
76 // -------------------------------------------------------------
77 // Step 1: Cleanup
78 // -------------------------------------------------------------
79 UpperBand.Clear();
80 MiddleBand.Clear();
81 LowerBand.Clear();
82​
83 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
84 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
85​
86 // -------------------------------------------------------------
87 // Step 2: Main Loop (SMA Calculation + Band Offset)
88 //
89 // [Why] (Efficiency)
90 // We compute the SMA on the fly (Rolling Sum) and immediately
91 // derive the bands, saving us from looping twice.
92 // -------------------------------------------------------------
93 decimal sum = 0;
94​
95 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
96 {
97 // Add new price to sum
98 sum += candleList[i].Close;
99​
100 // Remove old price from sum (Sliding Window text-book logic)
101 if (i >= Period)
102 {
103 sum -= candleList[i - Period].Close;
104 }
105​
106 // -------------------------------------------------------------
107 // Phase A: Insufficient Data
108 // -------------------------------------------------------------
109 if (i < Period - 1)
110 {
111 UpperBand.Add(null);
112 MiddleBand.Add(null);
113 LowerBand.Add(null);
114 continue;
115 }
116​
117 // -------------------------------------------------------------
118 // Phase B: Band Generation
119 //
120 // [Formula]
121 // SMA = Sum / Period
122 // Offset = SMA * (2.5 / 100) -> 2.5% of the average price
123 // Upper = SMA + Offset
124 // Lower = SMA - Offset
125 // -------------------------------------------------------------
126 decimal sma = sum / Period;
127 decimal offset = sma * (Percentage / 100m);
128​
129 MiddleBand.Add(sma);
130 UpperBand.Add(sma + offset);
131 LowerBand.Add(sma - offset);
132 }
133 }
134​
135 // =============================================================================
136 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
137 // =============================================================================
138 public static (List<decimal?> upper, List<decimal?> middle, List<decimal?> lower) Calculate(
139 IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 20, decimal percentage = 2.5m)
140 {
141 var env = new Envelope(period, percentage);
142 env.Calculate(candles);
143 return (env.UpperBand, env.MiddleBand, env.LowerBand);
144 }
145 }
146}

1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Moving Average Envelopes)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Moving Average Envelopes. We explain *why* code is written this way
7# and *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Parallel Channels
11# - Envelopes construct a "channel" around the price using a central Moving Average.
12# - Unlike Bollinger Bands (which use Volatility/SD), Envelopes use a fixed
13# percentage distance.
14#
15# 2. Trend & Reversal Detection
16# - Trend: If price stays within the bands, the trend is considered normal.
17# - Breakout: Price closing outside bands often signals a strong move (momentum)
18# or an overextended state (reversal potential).
19#
20# 3. The Formula
21# - Middle Band = SMA(Period)
22# - Upper Band = Middle Band + (Middle Band * Percentage)
23# - Lower Band = Middle Band - (Middle Band * Percentage)
24#
25# =============================================================================
26​
27# -------------------------------------------------------------
28# Type-Level Explanation: Envelope (class)
29#
30# [Why] Computes 3 linked series (Bands).
31# [What] Simple channel indicator.
32# [How] Calculates a Simple Moving Average (SMA) and creates parallel bands (upper/lower) by shifting the SMA by a fixed percentage.
33# [Who] Grid traders, Mean Reversion systems.
34# -------------------------------------------------------------
35class Envelope:
36
37 # -------------------------------------------------------------
38 # Variable Definition: upper_band
39 # [Role] The resistance line. Price > Upper often means Overbought.
40 # -------------------------------------------------------------
41 # upper_band = []
42​
43 # -------------------------------------------------------------
44 # Variable Definition: middle_band
45 # [Role] The baseline (Trend). Usually a Simple Moving Average.
46 # -------------------------------------------------------------
47 # middle_band = []
48​
49 # -------------------------------------------------------------
50 # Variable Definition: lower_band
51 # [Role] The support line. Price < Lower often means Oversold.
52 # -------------------------------------------------------------
53 # lower_band = []
54​
55 # -------------------------------------------------------------
56 # Constructor: __init__
57 #
58 # [Why]
59 # Configures the indicator's parameters:
60 # - period: Smoothing factor for the center line.
61 # - percentage: Width of the channel.
62 #
63 # [Fail Fast]
64 # Negative periods or invalid percentages are caught immediately.
65 # -------------------------------------------------------------
66 def __init__(self, period=20, percentage=2.5):
67 # -------------------------------------------------------------
68 # Logic Step 1: Validate Period
69 # [Decision] Is period > 0?
70 # -------------------------------------------------------------
71 if period <= 0:
72 raise ValueError("period must be greater than 0")
73
74 self.period = period
75 self.percentage = percentage
76
77 # Initialize storage
78 self.upper_band = []
79 self.middle_band = []
80 self.lower_band = []
81​
82 # =============================================================================
83 # IPO: calculate
84 # =============================================================================
85 #
86 # [Input]
87 # - candles: List[dict] (Price data)
88 #
89 # [Process]
90 # 1. Iterate through candles using a Sliding Window for SMA efficiency.
91 # 2. Compute the Simple Moving Average (Middle Band).
92 # 3. Calculate the Percentage Offset.
93 # 4. Add/Subtract Offset to get Upper/Lower Bands.
94 #
95 # [Output]
96 # - None (Populates member lists).
97 # =============================================================================
98 def calculate(self, candles):
99
100 # -------------------------------------------------------------
101 # Logic Step 1: Reset
102 # [Why] Clears old data to prevent stale state issues.
103 # -------------------------------------------------------------
104 self.upper_band.clear()
105 self.middle_band.clear()
106 self.lower_band.clear()
107
108 if len(candles) == 0:
109 return
110​
111 # -------------------------------------------------------------
112 # Logic Step 2: Sliding Window Algorithm
113 #
114 # [Why]
115 # Calculating Sum(Range) every time is O(N*M).
116 # Using a running sum (Add New, Remove Old) is O(N).
117 # This makes the indicator much faster on large datasets.
118 # -------------------------------------------------------------
119 s = 0.0
120
121 for i in range(len(candles)):
122
123 # Logic Step 2.1: Add the New Price
124 s += candles[i]['close']
125
126 # Logic Step 2.2: Remove the Old Price (if window is full)
127 if i >= self.period:
128 s -= candles[i - self.period]['close']
129
130 # Logic Step 2.3: Check for Validity
131 # If we haven't processed 'period' number of elements yet,
132 # we cannot form a complete average.
133 if i < self.period - 1:
134 self.upper_band.append(None)
135 self.middle_band.append(None)
136 self.lower_band.append(None)
137 continue
138​
139 # -------------------------------------------------------------
140 # Logic Step 3: Compute Bands
141 #
142 # [Visual]
143 # SMA (Middle) = 100.0
144 # Percentage = 2.5%
145 # Offset = 100 * 0.025 = 2.5
146 # Upper = 100 + 2.5 = 102.5
147 # Lower = 100 - 2.5 = 97.5
148 # -------------------------------------------------------------
149
150 # Calculate SMA
151 sma = s / self.period
152
153 # Calculate the vertical distance (Offset)
154 offset = sma * (self.percentage / 100.0)
155
156 # Store results
157 self.middle_band.append(sma)
158 self.upper_band.append(sma + offset)
159 self.lower_band.append(sma - offset)
160​
161# =============================================================================
162# Static Wrapper Function
163# =============================================================================
164#
165# [Why]
166# Simplifies usage for the end-user (Functional API).
167#
168# [Usage]
169# upper, middle, lower = calculate(candles, period=20, percentage=2.5)
170# =============================================================================
171def calculate(candles, period=20, percentage=2.5):
172 # 1. Instantiation
173 # [Why: Create the processor]
174 instance = Envelope(period, percentage)
175
176 # 2. Execution
177 # [Why: Run the math]
178 instance.calculate(candles)
179
180 # 3. Extraction
181 # [Why: Return the data]
182 return instance.upper_band, instance.middle_band, instance.lower_band
